title: It is time to think again about smart motorways
text:
The prefix “smart” on any initiative is designed to gull us into believing that it is better than something that has gone before. It often isn’t. As with the “smart” meters fiasco, whose roll-out across the country has been expensive and slow, so with “smart” motorways.

These multi-billion pound upgrades to existing roads have been under way for several years, causing widespread disruption and delays on some of our busiest highways. England has more than 100 miles of All Lane Running (ALR) smart motorways, with 225 miles more planned.
